document.masterDocTitle: A revision of the genus Cheliplana de Beauchamp, 1927 (Rhabdocoela: Schizorhynchia), with the description of six new species

bibRefCitation.author: Diez, Y. L. & Reygel, P. & Artois, T.
bibRefCitation.refString: Diez, Y. L., Reygel, P. & Artois, T. (2019) Schizorhynchia (Platyhelminthes, Rhabdocoela) from eastern Cuba, with the description of fifteen new species. Zootaxa, 4646 (1), 1 - 30. https: // doi. org / 10.11646 / zootaxa. 4646.1.1

subSubSection.paragraph: Remarks (summarised from literature). Live specimens are pinkish, translucent and rather small: The body length is 0.4‚Äì0.7 mm , as measured on whole mounts. The proboscis is armed with 13‚Äì18-¬µm-long, curved hooks. The muscular hook supports measure 5‚Äì8 ¬µm . The pharynx measures 1/7 to 1/8 of the total body length in live specimens. The spiny prepharyngeal cavity is elongated, measuring twice as long as the pharynx. The mouth opens antero-ventrally and subterminally.

The single testis lies postero-laterally to the pharynx and connects to paired seminal vesicles. Distally, the two seminal vesicles fuse into a short, seminal duct, which opens into the copulatory bulb. Two proximal ducts of unknown origin enter the prostate vesicle near the entrance of the seminal duct. The 62‚Äì66-¬µm-long cirrus is armed with fine spines. Distally, the cirrus is slightly widened and surrounded by an asymmetric sclerotised cap ( 10‚Äì20 ¬µm x 6‚Äì10 ¬µm ). Cirrus spines measure 2‚Äì3 ¬µm in this region.

The vitellarium extends from the pharynx to the copulatory bulb. A single, kidney-shaped ovary is present. Oocytes occur in a row and proximally decrease in diameter. The bursa lies caudally from the common gonopore.
